Fifth avenue tea room in Regina, it also had pin ball machines 5 cents, the old soda fountain serpentine counter and spinner stools. Bottled Coke was 6 cents and you got 2 cents back if you returned the bottle!!!!!!

comments.content: I still use my potato masher.  No sense pulling out the electric mixer for this.  At times it can be therapeutic. You can really let out your aggressive feelings.
I know that thing, that's the thing my mom used to grab to beat my ass with when she couldn't reach the wooden spoon hanging on the wall. The technical name is Assbeatus Metalis!

Yes, Still have one use it for more than mashing potatoes. Chop hamburger,  or other ground meats cooking on the stove. Also use for blending some items, mashing down tomatoes when stewing them for freezing. My cousin mixes her meatloaf with hers.
Grew up with it.  Use it almost every day, Joe.. when *I* cook in the kitchen... unless the wife does a grill thing (I'm far from being "the grill master" in this family)... then it's not used.   :(
Yes I do know what that is. It's a potatoe smasher. It makes wonderful mash potatoes. I have used one before. I still have mine.it's in my kitchen draw. It's also good for smashing  other things too.
Used it yesterday and I'm only 26. Its not age. Its experience. Most people my age these days don't know the difference between a teaspoon and a tablespoon.

Lost my old wood handled one (50+ years old, my grandmother's).  Searched for over a year to find another this style (oxo good grip).  So many other mashers focus on style instead of function.  They get clogged and don't work well.

I used to use this as a back scratcher but I know it's a potato masher.  N I also improvised a NEW, UNUSED toilet brush as a very effective back scratcher too.  Actually the toilet brush is my favorite n is great in the shower. It really removes all the dead skin off ur back n leaves it pretty soft too !
Still use one just like this for my mashed potatoes.  It was my mothers 70 odd years ago.  I just have to supply the muscles and energy to make it go.  Works Good!
Yep...have two of them. I put urethane over the paint on the handles, (some made with wooden handles may have lead paint on them). Can't find anything that mashes better.

I have it sitting on display next to my hand crank mixer. I love vintage

description: Ashley Robbins Holbrook  is  feeling broken. Our world has totally been flipped upside down. The agonizing words "I'm sorry there's nothing more we can do" has haunted us for the past 12 hours. We have to hold on to hope and faith even when the days ahead of us are uncertain. The cancer is back and it has spread across the top right side of Robbie's brain and surgery is no longer an option. We are home prepping for war once again- we refuse to give up the fight! We insisted he come home on an NG tube to keep his nutrition up and to give meds. I don't what we are going to do next, we are consulting doctors from all over.  God is bigger than any cancer and miracles happen everyday! Please continue to pray hard for our little boy!
